metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: At the heart of Git is collaboration.
content.html: At the heart of Git is collaboration.

content.text: However, Git does not allow you to add code to someone else's repository without access rights.
content.html: However, Git does not allow you to add code to someone else's repository without access rights.

content.text: In these next 3 chapters we will show you how to copy a repository, make changes to it, and suggest those changes be implemented to the original repository.
content.html: In these next 3 chapters we will show you how to copy a repository, make changes to it, and suggest those changes be implemented to the original repository.

content.text: At the end of these chapters, you will have the opportunity to add a message to our public GitHub page: https://w3schools-test.github.io/
content.html: At the end of these chapters, you will have the opportunity to add a message to our public GitHub page: https://w3schools-test.github.io/

content.text: A fork is a copy of a repository.
content.html: A fork is a copy of a repository.

content.text: This is useful when you want to contribute to someone else's project or start your own project based on theirs.
content.html: This is useful when you want to contribute to someone else's project or start your own project based on theirs.

content.text: fork is not a command in Git, but something offered in GitHub and other repository hosts.
content.html: fork is not a command in Git, but something offered in GitHub and other repository hosts.

content.text: Let's start by logging in to GitHub, and fork our repository: https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io
content.html:
Let's start by logging in to GitHub, and fork our repository:
https://github.com/w3schools-test/w3schools-test.github.io

content.text: Now we have our own copy of w3schools-test.github.io :
content.html: Now we have our own copy of w3schools-test.github.io:

content.text: Now let's look at how we add a local copy of this for us to work with.
content.html: Now let's look at how we add a local copy of this for us to work with.
